definition: to carry along/to carry on one's person/to carry secretly
to clasp under the arm/to coerce
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: It is forbidden to bring fireworks on board trains during Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 春运期间，禁止挟带烟花爆竹上车。

sentences.english: Haven't you noticed that people whose death is caused by weapons are usually weapon- carriers themselves?
sentences.chinese: 君不见死于刀枪下的人，都是挟带武器的人？

sentences.english: A landslide brings down tons of debris.
sentences.chinese: 山崩挟带下大量的碎岩石。

sentences.english: Trains allow bicycles to be carried in the baggage car.
sentences.chinese: 火车上允许乘客把挟带的自行车放在行李车厢中。

sentences.english: The article deals with principle, solvents and entrainers of supercritical fluids extraction.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍了超临界萃取的原理，溶媒及挟带剂。

sentences.english: The dense clouds on the north and west side of the storm carried intense snow.
sentences.chinese: 风暴西侧和北侧的云团挟带了强降雪。

definition: to carry within it/to be mixed in/to slip sth in/to intersperse/(hydrology etc) to entrain/to smuggle/notes smuggled into an exam
to wrap up/(fig.) to envelop/to swallow up
to cascade down/to flow in torrents/(fig.) outpouring (of emotions)
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to clasp under the arm/to coerce
